required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of High Protein, High-calorie Oral Nutritional Supplementation in Malnourished Elderly in Nursing Homes.
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of High Protein, High-calorie Nutritional Supplementation in Malnourished Elderly in Nursing Homes. A Prospective, Observational, Multicentric Study (PROT-e-GER Study)

brief_summary.textblock: The hypothesis of this study is that the administration of a high-calorie high-protein oral nutritional supplement twice a day for three months to elderly malnourished in residents in Spain is associated with improved nutritional status, with an increase in body weight of between 5 and 8%, and an improvement in functional status, with low incidence of complication.

detailed_description.textblock: A prospective, multi centric, observational study. The study is conducted in elderly living in nursing homes in Spain.

primary_outcome.description: Difference between the weight of the residents at the beginning and at the end of the study

secondary_outcome.description: Functional status at the end of the study
Ability in Activities of Daily Living at the end of the study

other_outcome.measure: Number of drinking bottles during the study.
other_outcome.description: Evaluate the compliance with the oral nutritional supplementation

arm_group.description: All of the residents included receive ONS

intervention.description: The residents included receive 2 bottle por day.

study_pop.textblock: Malnourished elderly living in nursing homes

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age greater than or equal to 65 years,
- Living in nursing homes,
- Malnutrition treated with an hyper-caloric oral nutritional supplementation (1.3 Kcal / ml) and high-protein (protein 20%).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Tube feeding (nasogastric or gastrostomy)
- Terminally ill or palliative treatment and residents with life expectancy of less than 6 months
- Special nutritional requirements (for example by intestinal malabsorption, short bowel residents or specific nutrition for renal insufficiency).

overall_official.affiliation: Head of Geriatric Department, Hospital Universitario Ramón y Cajal
